title.value: LitLLM: A Toolkit for Scientific Literature Review
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: LitLLM: A Toolkit for Scientific Literature Review

extractions.description: The paper introduces LitLLM, a toolkit designed to assist researchers in conducting literature reviews using Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) principles. The system leverages Large Language Models (LLMs) for summarizing abstracts, retrieving and re-ranking relevant papers, and generating related work sections, aiming to reduce the time and effort required for literature reviews.

type.justification: The paper presents a system, LitLLM, and provides implementation details, as well as user experiences and usage studies, indicating its empirical nature.
type.quote: As a preliminary study, we provided access to our user interface to 5 different researchers who worked through the demo to write literature reviews and validate the systemâ€™s efficacy.

name.justification: The paper focuses on the use of LLMs and RAG techniques, which are core topics in the field of Natural Language Processing.
name.quote: Following recent advances in large language models (LLMs), a new set of systems provides even more advanced features.

name.justification: The paper specifically addresses the task of conducting literature reviews using NLP techniques.
name.quote: LitLLM is an interactive tool to help scientists write the literature review or related work section of a scientific paper starting from a user-provided abstract.

name.justification: The paper mentions the use of GPT-3.5-turbo for generating results.
name.quote: In this work, we use OpenAI API to generate results for LLM using GPT-3.5-turbo and GPT-4 model.
